TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi sealed beforefieldinit ContainerUIElement3D extends System.Windows.UIElement3D
Public NotInheritable Class ContainerUIElement3D Inherits UIElement3D
public ref class ContainerUIElement3D sealed : System::Windows::UIElement3D

remarks.format:
## Remarks The <xref:System.Windows.Media.Media3D.ContainerUIElement3D.Children%2A> collection of a <xref:System.Windows.Media.Media3D.ContainerUIElement3D> element can only consist of <xref:System.Windows.UIElement3D> objects. Adding a <xref:System.Windows.UIElement3D> child to a <xref:System.Windows.Media.Media3D.ContainerUIElement3D> implicitly adds it to the <xref:System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Visual3DCollection> for the <xref:System.Windows.Media.Media3D.ContainerUIElement3D> element.
<xref:System.Windows.Media.Media3D.ContainerUIElement3D> does not have a visual representation; it serves as a container for other visual 3-D objects. <xref:System.Windows.Media.Media3D.ContainerUIElement3D> is a <xref:System.Windows.UIElement3D> object, which provides support for input, focus, and events in 3-D.
This class does not set the <xref:System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Visual3D.Visual3DModel%2A> property.
<xref:System.Windows.Media.Media3D.ContainerUIElement3D> is introduced in the .NET Framework version 3.5. For more information, see [Versions and Dependencies](~/docs/framework/migration-guide/versions-and-dependencies.md).
## Examples In the following example, the <xref:System.Windows.Media.Media3D.ContainerUIElement3D> object contains two cubes as its children:
[!code-xaml[ContainerModelSample#Viewport3D](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_Wpf/ContainerModelSample/CSharp/Window1.xaml#viewport3d)]
The following shows the event handler of the container:
[!code-csharp[ContainerModelSample#ContainerMouseDown](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_Wpf/ContainerModelSample/CSharp/Window1.xaml.cs#containermousedown)] [!code-vb[ContainerModelSample#ContainerMouseDown](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_Wpf/ContainerModelSample/visualbasic/window1.xaml.vb#containermousedown)]
For the complete sample, see [Handling Events in 3-D Sample](https://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=159992) .

Adding a <xref:System.Windows.UIElement3D> child to a <xref:System.Windows.Media.Media3D.ContainerUIElement3D> implicitly adds it to the <xref:System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Visual3DCollection> for the <xref:System.Windows.Media.Media3D.ContainerUIElement3D> element.
